26#ifndef DRM_FOURCC_H
27#define DRM_FOURCC_H
28
29#include <linux/types.h>
30
31#define fourcc_code(a, b, c, d) ((__u32)(a) | ((__u32)(b) << 8) | \
32 ((__u32)(c) << 16) | ((__u32)(d) << 24))
33
34#define DRM_FORMAT_BIG_ENDIAN (1<<31) /* format is big endian instead of little endian */
35
36/* color index */
37#define DRM_FORMAT_C8 fourcc_code('C', '8', ' ', ' ') /* [7:0] C */
38
39/* 8 bpp Red */
40#define DRM_FORMAT_R8 fourcc_code('R', '8', ' ', ' ') /* [7:0] R */
41
42/* 16 bpp RG */
43#define DRM_FORMAT_RG88 fourcc_code('R', 'G', '8', '8') /* [15:0] R:G 8:8 little endian */
44#define DRM_FORMAT_GR88 fourcc_code('G', 'R', '8', '8') /* [15:0] G:R 8:8 little endian */
45
46/* 8 bpp RGB */
47#define DRM_FORMAT_RGB332 fourcc_code('R', 'G', 'B', '8') /* [7:0] R:G:B 3:3:2 */
48#define DRM_FORMAT_BGR233 fourcc_code('B', 'G', 'R', '8') /* [7:0] B:G:R 2:3:3 */
49
50/* 16 bpp RGB */
51#define DRM_FORMAT_XRGB4444 fourcc_code('X', 'R', '1', '2') /* [15:0] x:R:G:B 4:4:4:4 little endian */
52#define DRM_FORMAT_XBGR4444 fourcc_code('X', 'B', '1', '2') /* [15:0] x:B:G:R 4:4:4:4 little endian */
53#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBX4444 fourcc_code('R', 'X', '1', '2') /* [15:0] R:G:B:x 4:4:4:4 little endian */
54#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRX4444 fourcc_code('B', 'X', '1', '2') /* [15:0] B:G:R:x 4:4:4:4 little endian */
55
56#define DRM_FORMAT_ARGB4444 fourcc_code('A', 'R', '1', '2') /* [15:0] A:R:G:B 4:4:4:4 little endian */
57#define DRM_FORMAT_ABGR4444 fourcc_code('A', 'B', '1', '2') /* [15:0] A:B:G:R 4:4:4:4 little endian */
58#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBA4444 fourcc_code('R', 'A', '1', '2') /* [15:0] R:G:B:A 4:4:4:4 little endian */
59#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRA4444 fourcc_code('B', 'A', '1', '2') /* [15:0] B:G:R:A 4:4:4:4 little endian */
60
61#define DRM_FORMAT_XRGB1555 fourcc_code('X', 'R', '1', '5') /* [15:0] x:R:G:B 1:5:5:5 little endian */
62#define DRM_FORMAT_XBGR1555 fourcc_code('X', 'B', '1', '5') /* [15:0] x:B:G:R 1:5:5:5 little endian */
63#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBX5551 fourcc_code('R', 'X', '1', '5') /* [15:0] R:G:B:x 5:5:5:1 little endian */
64#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRX5551 fourcc_code('B', 'X', '1', '5') /* [15:0] B:G:R:x 5:5:5:1 little endian */
65
66#define DRM_FORMAT_ARGB1555 fourcc_code('A', 'R', '1', '5') /* [15:0] A:R:G:B 1:5:5:5 little endian */
67#define DRM_FORMAT_ABGR1555 fourcc_code('A', 'B', '1', '5') /* [15:0] A:B:G:R 1:5:5:5 little endian */
68#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBA5551 fourcc_code('R', 'A', '1', '5') /* [15:0] R:G:B:A 5:5:5:1 little endian */
69#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRA5551 fourcc_code('B', 'A', '1', '5') /* [15:0] B:G:R:A 5:5:5:1 little endian */
70
71#define DRM_FORMAT_RGB565 fourcc_code('R', 'G', '1', '6') /* [15:0] R:G:B 5:6:5 little endian */
72#define DRM_FORMAT_BGR565 fourcc_code('B', 'G', '1', '6') /* [15:0] B:G:R 5:6:5 little endian */
73
74/* 24 bpp RGB */
75#define DRM_FORMAT_RGB888 fourcc_code('R', 'G', '2', '4') /* [23:0] R:G:B little endian */
76#define DRM_FORMAT_BGR888 fourcc_code('B', 'G', '2', '4') /* [23:0] B:G:R little endian */
77
78/* 32 bpp RGB */
79#define DRM_FORMAT_XRGB8888 fourcc_code('X', 'R', '2', '4') /* [31:0] x:R:G:B 8:8:8:8 little endian */
80#define DRM_FORMAT_XBGR8888 fourcc_code('X', 'B', '2', '4') /* [31:0] x:B:G:R 8:8:8:8 little endian */
81#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBX8888 fourcc_code('R', 'X', '2', '4') /* [31:0] R:G:B:x 8:8:8:8 little endian */
82#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRX8888 fourcc_code('B', 'X', '2', '4') /* [31:0] B:G:R:x 8:8:8:8 little endian */
83
84#define DRM_FORMAT_ARGB8888 fourcc_code('A', 'R', '2', '4') /* [31:0] A:R:G:B 8:8:8:8 little endian */
85#define DRM_FORMAT_ABGR8888 fourcc_code('A', 'B', '2', '4') /* [31:0] A:B:G:R 8:8:8:8 little endian */
86#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBA8888 fourcc_code('R', 'A', '2', '4') /* [31:0] R:G:B:A 8:8:8:8 little endian */
87#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRA8888 fourcc_code('B', 'A', '2', '4') /* [31:0] B:G:R:A 8:8:8:8 little endian */
88
89#define DRM_FORMAT_XRGB2101010 fourcc_code('X', 'R', '3', '0') /* [31:0] x:R:G:B 2:10:10:10 little endian */
90#define DRM_FORMAT_XBGR2101010 fourcc_code('X', 'B', '3', '0') /* [31:0] x:B:G:R 2:10:10:10 little endian */
91#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBX1010102 fourcc_code('R', 'X', '3', '0') /* [31:0] R:G:B:x 10:10:10:2 little endian */
92#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRX1010102 fourcc_code('B', 'X', '3', '0') /* [31:0] B:G:R:x 10:10:10:2 little endian */
93
94#define DRM_FORMAT_ARGB2101010 fourcc_code('A', 'R', '3', '0') /* [31:0] A:R:G:B 2:10:10:10 little endian */
95#define DRM_FORMAT_ABGR2101010 fourcc_code('A', 'B', '3', '0') /* [31:0] A:B:G:R 2:10:10:10 little endian */
96#define DRM_FORMAT_RGBA1010102 fourcc_code('R', 'A', '3', '0') /* [31:0] R:G:B:A 10:10:10:2 little endian */
97#define DRM_FORMAT_BGRA1010102 fourcc_code('B', 'A', '3', '0') /* [31:0] B:G:R:A 10:10:10:2 little endian */
98
99/* packed YCbCr */
100#define DRM_FORMAT_YUYV fourcc_code('Y', 'U', 'Y', 'V') /* [31:0] Cr0:Y1:Cb0:Y0 8:8:8:8 little endian */
101#define DRM_FORMAT_YVYU fourcc_code('Y', 'V', 'Y', 'U') /* [31:0] Cb0:Y1:Cr0:Y0 8:8:8:8 little endian */
102#define DRM_FORMAT_UYVY fourcc_code('U', 'Y', 'V', 'Y') /* [31:0] Y1:Cr0:Y0:Cb0 8:8:8:8 little endian */
103#define DRM_FORMAT_VYUY fourcc_code('V', 'Y', 'U', 'Y') /* [31:0] Y1:Cb0:Y0:Cr0 8:8:8:8 little endian */
104
105#define DRM_FORMAT_AYUV fourcc_code('A', 'Y', 'U', 'V') /* [31:0] A:Y:Cb:Cr 8:8:8:8 little endian */
106
107/*
108 * 2 plane YCbCr
109 * index 0 = Y plane, [7:0] Y
110 * index 1 = Cr:Cb plane, [15:0] Cr:Cb little endian
111 * or
112 * index 1 = Cb:Cr plane, [15:0] Cb:Cr little endian
113 */
114#define DRM_FORMAT_NV12 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '1', '2') /* 2x2 subsampled Cr:Cb plane */
115#define DRM_FORMAT_NV21 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '2', '1') /* 2x2 subsampled Cb:Cr plane */
116#define DRM_FORMAT_NV16 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '1', '6') /* 2x1 subsampled Cr:Cb plane */
117#define DRM_FORMAT_NV61 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '6', '1') /* 2x1 subsampled Cb:Cr plane */
118#define DRM_FORMAT_NV24 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '2', '4') /* non-subsampled Cr:Cb plane */
119#define DRM_FORMAT_NV42 fourcc_code('N', 'V', '4', '2') /* non-subsampled Cb:Cr plane */
120
121/*
122 * 3 plane YCbCr
123 * index 0: Y plane, [7:0] Y
124 * index 1: Cb plane, [7:0] Cb
125 * index 2: Cr plane, [7:0] Cr
126 * or
127 * index 1: Cr plane, [7:0] Cr
128 * index 2: Cb plane, [7:0] Cb
129 */
130#define DRM_FORMAT_YUV410 fourcc_code('Y', 'U', 'V', '9') /* 4x4 subsampled Cb (1) and Cr (2) planes */
131#define DRM_FORMAT_YVU410 fourcc_code('Y', 'V', 'U', '9') /* 4x4 subsampled Cr (1) and Cb (2) planes */
132#define DRM_FORMAT_YUV411 fourcc_code('Y', 'U', '1', '1') /* 4x1 subsampled Cb (1) and Cr (2) planes */
133#define DRM_FORMAT_YVU411 fourcc_code('Y', 'V', '1', '1') /* 4x1 subsampled Cr (1) and Cb (2) planes */
134#define DRM_FORMAT_YUV420 fourcc_code('Y', 'U', '1', '2') /* 2x2 subsampled Cb (1) and Cr (2) planes */
135#define DRM_FORMAT_YVU420 fourcc_code('Y', 'V', '1', '2') /* 2x2 subsampled Cr (1) and Cb (2) planes */
136#define DRM_FORMAT_YUV422 fourcc_code('Y', 'U', '1', '6') /* 2x1 subsampled Cb (1) and Cr (2) planes */
137#define DRM_FORMAT_YVU422 fourcc_code('Y', 'V', '1', '6') /* 2x1 subsampled Cr (1) and Cb (2) planes */
138#define DRM_FORMAT_YUV444 fourcc_code('Y', 'U', '2', '4') /* non-subsampled Cb (1) and Cr (2) planes */
139#define DRM_FORMAT_YVU444 fourcc_code('Y', 'V', '2', '4') /* non-subsampled Cr (1) and Cb (2) planes */
140
141
142/*
143 * Format Modifiers:
144 *
145 * Format modifiers describe, typically, a re-ordering or modification
146 * of the data in a plane of an FB. This can be used to express tiled/
147 * swizzled formats, or compression, or a combination of the two.
148 *
149 * The upper 8 bits of the format modifier are a vendor-id as assigned
150 * below. The lower 56 bits are assigned as vendor sees fit.
151 */
152
153/* Vendor Ids: */
154#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_NONE 0
155#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_NONE 0
156#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_INTEL 0x01
157#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_AMD 0x02
158#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_NV 0x03
159#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_SAMSUNG 0x04
160#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_QCOM 0x05
161/* add more to the end as needed */
162
163#define fourcc_mod_code(vendor, val) \
164 ((((__u64)DRM_FORMAT_MOD_VENDOR_## vendor) << 56) | (val & 0x00ffffffffffffffULL))
165
166/*
167 * Format Modifier tokens:
168 *
169 * When adding a new token please document the layout with a code comment,
170 * similar to the fourcc codes above. drm_fourcc.h is considered the
171 * authoritative source for all of these.
172 */
173
174/* Intel framebuffer modifiers */
175
176/*
177 * Intel X-tiling layout
178 *
179 * This is a tiled layout using 4Kb tiles (except on gen2 where the tiles 2Kb)
180 * in row-major layout. Within the tile bytes are laid out row-major, with
181 * a platform-dependent stride. On top of that the memory can apply
182 * platform-depending swizzling of some higher address bits into bit6.
183 *
184 * This format is highly platforms specific and not useful for cross-driver
185 * sharing. It exists since on a given platform it does uniquely identify the
186 * layout in a simple way for i915-specific userspace.
187 */
188#define I915_FORMAT_MOD_X_TILED fourcc_mod_code(INTEL, 1)
189
190/*
191 * Intel Y-tiling layout
192 *
193 * This is a tiled layout using 4Kb tiles (except on gen2 where the tiles 2Kb)
194 * in row-major layout. Within the tile bytes are laid out in OWORD (16 bytes)
195 * chunks column-major, with a platform-dependent height. On top of that the
196 * memory can apply platform-depending swizzling of some higher address bits
197 * into bit6.
198 *
199 * This format is highly platforms specific and not useful for cross-driver
200 * sharing. It exists since on a given platform it does uniquely identify the
201 * layout in a simple way for i915-specific userspace.
202 */
203#define I915_FORMAT_MOD_Y_TILED fourcc_mod_code(INTEL, 2)
204
205/*
206 * Intel Yf-tiling layout
207 *
208 * This is a tiled layout using 4Kb tiles in row-major layout.
209 * Within the tile pixels are laid out in 16 256 byte units / sub-tiles which
210 * are arranged in four groups (two wide, two high) with column-major layout.
211 * Each group therefore consits out of four 256 byte units, which are also laid
212 * out as 2x2 column-major.
213 * 256 byte units are made out of four 64 byte blocks of pixels, producing
214 * either a square block or a 2:1 unit.
215 * 64 byte blocks of pixels contain four pixel rows of 16 bytes, where the width
216 * in pixel depends on the pixel depth.
217 */
218#define I915_FORMAT_MOD_Yf_TILED fourcc_mod_code(INTEL, 3)
219
220/*
221 * Tiled, NV12MT, grouped in 64 (pixels) x 32 (lines) -sized macroblocks
222 *
223 * Macroblocks are laid in a Z-shape, and each pixel data is following the
224 * standard NV12 style.
225 * As for NV12, an image is the result of two frame buffers: one for Y,
226 * one for the interleaved Cb/Cr components (1/2 the height of the Y buffer).
227 * Alignment requirements are (for each buffer):
228 * - multiple of 128 pixels for the width
229 * - multiple of 32 pixels for the height
230 *
231 * For more information: see http://linuxtv.org/downloads/v4l-dvb-apis/re32.html
232 */
233#define DRM_FORMAT_MOD_SAMSUNG_64_32_TILE fourcc_mod_code(SAMSUNG, 1)
234
235#endif /* DRM_FOURCC_H */
236
